result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Myles Makeshimfirst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs payable as follows:  $100.00 per month starting on or before May 1, 2019 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.  Bond on file applied.  Remaining balance due is $329.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Myles Makeshimfirst

records.addlTxt: $175.00 coming from GPS.  (09:45 EST)

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Swank for Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead guilty to the charge.    Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1) as domestic abuse contrary to 968.075(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for:  $100.00 fine, plus costs.  $679.00 total. Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.

Court ordered:  $100.00 fine, plus costs.  $679.00 total.  Pay @ $100.00 per month starting 5/1.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 1, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
STC canceled and scheduled for PLEAS at request of SPD Sebion; ok'd with DA's office.
Victim Rights Compliance Form

Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 7, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defense entered NGP.    NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 12/12 and STC set for 1/7 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
$200 coming from GPS for the cash bond.

Defendant appears by video from Jackson County Jail without counsel present.  District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  SPD Carly Sebion his attorney as of August.  He has been trying to call her but hasn't heard back.  Explained why he hasn't taken care of this matter.  *****Address:  521  11th Ave N., Wisconsin Rapids, WI  54495.

State requests a $200 cash bond with no alcohol conditions as listed on the original bond.  Defendant makes stateement to the Court.  Court orders an additional $200 cash bond as requested.  He is to call the public defender.  AIA 11-19 at 9 a.m.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant FTA for AIA.  Warrant authorized.  Cash bond ordered forfeited.

Defendant appeared without counsel.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared as a cash bond signed had a return date of today.  Defendant states he has received the complaint and his address is correct.  Court reads charge and potential penalties.  Court explains attorney options and that he should contact the SPDO first.  Cash bond amended to include conditions as requested by the State.  Court set for adjourned intial appearance on 5-26-15 at 9:30 a.m.
